definitions.definition: (of a thing) not able to be found because it is not in its expected place.
examples: a quantity of cash has gone missing

definitions.definition: not present or included when expected or supposed to be.
examples: passion was an element that had been missing from her life for too long
synonyms: wanting "passion was missing from her life"

definitions.definition: (of a person) absent from a place, especially home, and of unknown whereabouts.
examples: she alerted police that her son was missing

definitions.definition: (of a person) not yet traced or confirmed as alive, but not known to be dead, after an accident or during wartime.
examples: servicemen listed as missing in action

definitions.definition: fail to hit, reach, or come into contact with (something aimed at).
examples: a laser-guided bomb had missed its target

definitions.definition: pass by without touching; chance not to hit.
examples: a piece of shrapnel missed him by inches
synonyms: fall short of "the shot missed her by inches"

definitions.definition: fail to catch (something thrown or dropped).
examples: fail to catch, drop, fumble, bobble, fluff, flub, mishandle, screw up Mandy missed the ball

definitions.definition: be too late to catch (a passenger vehicle, etc.).
examples: we'll miss the train if he doesn't hurry
synonyms: fail to catch/get "I've missed my bus"

definitions.definition: fail to notice, hear, or understand.
examples: the villa is impossible to miss—it's right by the road
synonyms: mishear More"I missed what you said"fail to see/notice

definitions.definition: fail to attend, participate in, or watch (something one is expected to do or habitually does).
examples: teachers were supposed to report those students who missed class that day

definitions.definition: fail to see or have a meeting with (someone).
examples: “Potter's been here this morning?” “You've just missed him.”

definitions.definition: not be able to experience or fail to take advantage of (an opportunity or chance).
examples: don't miss the chance to visit the breathtaking Dolomites
synonyms: pass up "don't miss this exciting opportunity!"

examples: smart Christmas shoppers go out early to miss the crowds
synonyms: bypass "I left early to miss rush hour"

definitions.definition: fail to include (someone or something); omit.
examples: if we miss a few things in the first draft, we can add them later

definitions.definition: (of a woman) fail to have (a monthly period).
(of an engine or motor vehicle) undergo failure of ignition in one or more cylinders.
notice the loss or absence of.
examples: he's rich—he won't miss the money

definitions.definition: feel regret or sadness at no longer being able to enjoy the presence of.
examples: she misses all her old friends
synonyms: long to see "she missed him when he was away"

definitions.definition: feel regret or sadness at no longer being able to go to, do, or have.
examples: I still miss France and I wish I could go back
